summary: The term "congenital malformation," categorized under health, is a redirect to the preferred term "congenital disease." In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, congenital diseases encompass a range of conditions arising from genetic or environmental factors that manifest at birth. The EU has established various regulations aimed at addressing public health concerns related to congenital diseases, including directives on prenatal screening and genetic testing. These regulations seek to ensure that affected individuals receive appropriate medical care and support, thereby enhancing health outcomes across member states. Understanding congenital diseases is crucial for effective health policy formulation and implementation within the EU.
